alert.note: Alert for Crockett; Sutton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 25 at 5:01AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Crockett and southwestern Sutton Counties through 600 AM CDT... At 501 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles southwest of Sonora, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... The Intersection Of Highway 163 And Ranch Road 1973, The Intersection Of Us-277 And Ranch Road 189 and Us-277 Near The Sutton- Edwards County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
